definition: to hold with one's mouth (as a smoker with a cigarette or a dog with a bone)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: From then on, the sheep of this shepherd hadn't been thieved by the wolf any more.
sentences.chinese: 从此，那个牧民的羊就再也没有被家狼叼走过了。

sentences.english: I mean you can't walk into a restaurant, roll a joint, and start puffin' away.
sentences.chinese: 我是说，你不能叼着大麻走进一家餐馆，然后开始抽。

sentences.english: Drilling holes in the original wolf and from the sheep pen, but also guess, would leave a sheep.
sentences.chinese: 原来狼又从窟窿里钻进羊圈，又叼走了一只羊。

sentences.english: Mork said, then picked up the meat and flew away.
sentences.chinese: 说完，默克叼起肉，轻快地飞走了。

sentences.english: She had my stickers in her mouth!
sentences.chinese: 它用嘴叼着我的粘贴画。

sentences.english: The hooligan stood leaning against the wall, cigarette between lips and scar on face.
sentences.chinese: 流氓斜倚着墙站着，嘴里叼根烟，脸上一个刀疤。

sentences.english: The raven hopped quickly from the branch and seized the nut in his beak.
sentences.chinese: 渡鸦很快从树枝上跳下来，把核桃叼走了。

sentences.english: The bushes in the mouth bird flowers habitat raising An Nian.
sentences.chinese: 那灌木丛里的知更雀就在叼起的花蕊里栖养安年。

sentences.english: A black fox came toward him, carrying a ptarmigan in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 一只黑狐狸朝他走了过来，嘴里叼着一只松鸡。

sentences.english: The dog puts down the bag, jumps up and presses the button.
sentences.chinese: 狗狗放下叼在嘴里的袋子，跳起来按下过马路的按钮。

sentences.english: The crane loosened the bone with its beak, and finally got it out.
sentences.chinese: 鹤用他的嘴巴把骨头弄松并且叼了出来。

sentences.chinese: 原来狼又从窟窿里钻进羊圈，又叼走了一只羊。

sentences.english: I am in struck with panically the hour just the attention arrive the mouth Diao of is a cake of abruptly of meat.
sentences.chinese: 我在惊惶失措时才注意到嘴里叼的是一块硬生生的肉。

sentences.english: The fox took the meat and went into its hole.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸叼起肉，就钻回洞里去了。

sentences.english: Mr May always has a pipe in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 梅先生嘴里总是叼着个烟斗。

definition: to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
